title: Storm brings strong winds and heavy rain to the Caribbean
description: Hurricane Elsa has become the first hurricane of the 2021 Atlantic hurricane season. Elsa is forecast to bring strong winds and heavy rain to the Windward and Leeward Islands on Friday. Meteorologist Jennifer Gray has the forecast.

title: A Boeing 737 cargo plane makes emergency landing in the water near Honolulu
description: A cargo plane made an emergency landing in the ocean off the coast of Honolulu, Hawaii, early Friday morning with two people on board, according to the Federal Aviation Administration.

title: White House goes into damage control mode after reports of dysfunction in Kamala Harris' office
description: The White House dove into damage control this week after reports of dysfunction and infighting in Vice President Kamala Harris' office, with the administration trying to stop a drama-filled narrative from taking hold, according to five people who spoke to CNN about the dynamics within Harris' office.

title: Iran plans to keep video footage of nuclear sites from UN watchdog until a deal with US is reached
description: Iran plans to prevent inspectors from the UN nuclear watchdog reviewing video footage of some nuclear sites until there is an agreement to salvage the Iran nuclear deal, a senior Iranian official told CNN.

title: Italy knocks out world No. 1 Belgium in Euro 2020 thriller
description: Italy narrowly overcame Belgium in one of the most thrilling games of Euro 2020 to book a date with Spain in the semifinals.

title: Germany issues world's strongest recommendation for mixing Covid vaccines
In fossilized dinosaur poop, scientists find hidden treasure
description: A previously undiscovered, 230-million-year-old beetle species has been found in the fossilized feces of a dinosaur ancestor, according to a study recently published in the journal Current Biology.

title: Visitors turned away as national park fills up in Utah
description: Imagine traveling across the country to visit one of the most stunning national parks in the United States only to find it's too crowded to get inside.

title: This national park is turning away visitors due to overcrowding
description: An influx of visitors is forcing Arches National Park in Utah to temporarily shut its gates almost daily. And disappointed visitors aren't the only consequence of overcrowding. The National Park Service is anticipating one of its busiest summers on record, so Arches won't be the only popular park where crowds could be an issue. CNN's Lucy Kafanov reports.

title: Cargo plane makes emergency landing in water near Honolulu
description: The pilots of a cargo plane that made an emergency water landing off the coast of Honolulu, Hawaii, told air traffic controllers one of their engines had failed moments before the flight went down, according to LiveATC recordings reviewed by CNN.

title: Trump's Hill allies could be ensnared in January 6 probe as GOP preps strategy
description: House Minority Leader Kevin McCarthy has asserted he'd "have no problem talking to anybody" about his conversations with then-President Donald Trump on January 6. That proposition may soon be put to the test.

title: Village devastated by wildfire after Canada heat wave
description: A fast-moving wildfire forced more than 1,000 people to evacuate from Lytton, Canada, one day after the village recorded the nation's all-time heat record.

title: Richard Branson: 'I would love Jeff Bezos to come and see our flight off'
description: Richard Branson, the British billionaire and entrepreneur, announced late Thursday that he would attempt to go to space on July 11, just nine days before the world's richest man, Jeff Bezos, will make his own spaceflight. But even as he effectively cut ahead of Bezos, Branson dismissed the notion of it being a "race" and went so far as to invite his fellow billionaire to come watch.

title: US races to find safe haven for Afghan translators as withdrawal nears
'I'm not going to answer any more': Biden frustrated after questions on Afghanistan
description: President Joe Biden grew irritated when questioned about the state of Afghanistan, where a formal withdrawal is nearly complete, and a major US air base was officially handed over even as US generals warn of a looming civil war.

title: Discovering the secrets of Eleuthera, the wild and rugged island of the Bahamas
description: In Eleuthera you can discover blue holes, tidal pools and Lady Di's pineapple farm. And in the island's surrounding waters, Bahamas Ocean Safaris takes us to find the swimming pigs, turtles and the disappearing Sand Dollar beach.

title: Trump-appointed judge rejects US Capitol rioter's claim he was 'selectively charged'
description: A Trump-appointed federal judge on Friday rejected claims from a US Capitol riot defendant that he had been "selectively charged" because he is a supporter of former President Donald Trump.

title: George Conway: I'd be very, very worried if I were Trump's children
description: Attorney George Conway says President Donald Trump's children should be "very, very worried" about the investigation into the Trump Organization.

title: See Eric Trump's interesting defense after Trump CFO's indictment
description: Trump Organization Executive Vice President Eric Trump reacts to charges against the Trump Organization and CFO Allen Weisselberg on Fox News.

title: Sha'Carri Richardson suspended from US Olympic team after testing positive for marijuana
description: US track and field star Sha'Carri Richardson has been suspended for one month from the Olympic team after testing positive for THC, a chemical found in marijuana, the US Anti-Doping Agency (USADA) announced on Friday.

title: Why Black creators wouldn't dance on TikTok to the latest Megan Thee Stallion track
description: When rapper Megan Thee Stallion's new song, "Thot Shit," dropped around mid-June, most thought it was only a matter of time until a new dance would pop up for it on TikTok.

title: The two latest threats to Trump unfolded almost simultaneously
Statues of Queen Victoria, Queen Elizabeth toppled in Canada
description: Protesters have toppled statues of Queen Victoria and Queen Elizabeth II in the Canadian city of Winnipeg as anger grows over the discovery of the remains of hundreds of children in unmarked graves at former indigenous schools.

title: Cows' stomachs can break down hard-to-recycle plastic, study finds
description: Researchers in Austria may have found an unlikely solution to the problem of plastic pollution: cows, and the microbes found inside their stomachs.

title: Why modern elephants survived ancient climate change when 180 other species didn't
description: The elephants we know and love today may be the ultimate survivors. While there are only three species of elephants now -- all of which are endangered and can be found across Africa and Asia -- they once belonged to a group called proboscideans that included 185 species living around the world.

title: Asked about protesting if she reaches Olympic podium, Gwen Berry says: 'We'll see'
description: US athlete Gwen berry says she is still thinking about how potentially to mark the moment if she were to reach the podium at the Tokyo OIympics given her history of protesting at major track and field events.

title: Conservative US justices call to revisit landmark First Amendment case
description: Justices Clarence Thomas and Neil Gorsuch on Friday said the Supreme Court should revisit the breadth of the landmark First Amendment decision in New York Times v. Sullivan and explore how it applies to social media and technology companies.

title: Italy to run luxury 'Dolce Vita' sleeper train
description: It's one of Europe's most beautiful countries with an immense amount of heritage: world famous cities, spectacular landscapes and a top notch railway system to get around.

title: Tesla sales rise despite problems with chips and China
description: Tesla managed to sell more than 200,000 vehicles last quarter, even as the company faced rising prices, a PR disaster in China and a shortage of computer chips.

title: China is building a sprawling network of missile silos, satellite imagery appears to show
description: China is building a sprawling network of what appear to be intercontinental ballistic missile silos in its western desert that analysts say could change the equation for US military planners in Asia.

title: A 'tool to empower': The evolution of women's sportswear
description: Before the advent of designer activewear, women's sportswear ranked low on the list of fashion priorities. But a new exhibition demonstrates that sporting attire has long been a valuable tool for self-expression and an important path towards greater liberation.

title: Golf's first Black professional who paved the way for Tiger Woods
description: When Charlie Sifford tried to play with the White golfers, he was told no.

title: Wages are going up. Here's what that means for the economy
description: When the latest US jobs report goes live on Friday, investors and economists will be closely watching the number of jobs added in June.

title: What it's like to travel to Greece right now
description: What awaits American visitors to Europe this summer is a byzantine and constantly-changing array of Covid-related restrictions and registration requirements. It's sort of like shifting mask mandates in the US, just with lots of paperwork and foreign languages thrown in. This is what I discovered on my Kafkaesque odyssey to Greece in June as an eager but under-prepared American.

title: Watch volcano erupt and spew over a half mile of ash
description: Thousands have been evacuated in the Philippines after authorities raised the alert status on a restive volcano.

title: Amber Heard, Johnny Depp's ex-wife, has had a baby girl
description: Amber Heard has announced that she is a new mother after welcoming her first child, a daughter named Oonagh Paige, earlier this year.

title: Mega rich buy $11M homes on world's biggest superyacht
description: Forget superyachts, a new residential vessel is on the way that's so huge, it's being referred to as a "yacht liner."

title: Ex-Disney star says conversion therapy left her with 'scars'
description: American actress Alyson Stoner has revealed she underwent conversion therapy while coming to terms with her sexuality, saying the experience left her with "emotional scars" and adding: "I know firsthand how dangerous it is."

title: Hong Kong policeman stabbed in 'lone wolf' attack, says security chief
description: A Hong Kong police officer is in critical condition after being stabbed in the back in what Hong Kong Security Chief Chris Tang called a "lone wolf" attack. The attacker died in hospital after stabbing himself in the chest following the attack. CNN's Ivan Watson reports.

title: US adds Turkey to list of countries implicated in use of child soldiers
description: The United States on Thursday added Turkey to a list of countries that are implicated in the use of child soldiers over the past year, placing a NATO ally for the first time in such a list, in a move that is likely to further complicate the already fraught ties between Ankara and Washington.

title: 'What we know now is how much we don't know': Enter the strange world of the ocean twilight zone
description: Drop through the ocean in the right place and eventually you'll enter the twilight zone. It's hundreds of meters down, yet not so far as the ocean floor. And in the middle ground between light and shadow, science is making incredible discoveries.

title: Norway's Karsten Warholm breaks men's 400m hurdles world record
description: Norway's Karsten Warholm broke Kevin Young's 29-year-old 400m hurdles world record when he completed the race in 46.70 seconds in front of his home fans at the Diamond League meeting in Oslo on Thursday.

title: This country vaccinated over 65% of its population. So why are cases rising?
description: Chile seemed to have done everything right in its fight against Covid-19 at the beginning -- acquiring vaccines, implementing lockdowns and mobilizing its health system. More than 65 percent of people in Chile have been fully vaccinated, yet infections and hospitalizations keep rising. CNN's Rafael Romo reports.

title: Chinese police asks public to adopt 'timid' dogs who failed training
description: Though all dogs are good boys (and girls), not all are suited for a job in law enforcement.

title: J&J Covid-19 vaccine lasts at least 8 months, protects against Delta variant, studies find
description: The Johnson & Johnson coronavirus vaccine provides immunity that lasts at least eight months, and it appears to provide adequate protection against the worrying Delta variant, the company said in a statement Thursday night.

title: Tax crime charges against the former President's namesake company and its chief financial officer Allen Weisselberg have been unsealed
description: Trump Organization chief financial officer Allen Weisselberg surrendered to the Manhattan district attorney's office Thursday morning ahead of expected criminal charges against him and the company in connection with alleged tax crimes, his attorney told CNN.

title: Attorney General Merrick Garland orders temporary halt of federal executions
description: Attorney General Merrick Garland has ordered a temporarily halt to federal executions as Justice Department senior officials review the policies and procedures for the controversial punishment.

title: Neutral Switzerland plans to buy dozens of US F-35 fighter jets
description: Switzerland has chosen Lockheed Martin's F-35A Lightning II as its next-generation fighter jet, the government said on Wednesday, angering opponents who have pledged a new referendum to overturn what they dubbed an unnecessary "Ferrari" option.

title: Co-conservator of Britney Spears' estate requests to resign
description: One day after Los Angeles Superior Court Judge Brenda Penny ordered Bessemer Trust co-conservator of Britney Spears' $60 million estate, making official a November request, the wealth management firm has asked to resign.

title: Canadian village heavily damaged by wildfires a day after temperatures topped 121 degrees
description: A day after a village in British Columbia saw Canada's highest recorded temperature, the town of Lytton suffered extensive damage from a wildfire that led the town's mayor to order residents to evacuate.
